Countrycode: BLZ
Text: ï»¿We in Belize are keenly aware of the essential role the United Nations plays in advancing the cause of freedom
Totalmentions: peace and justice throughout the world. Our struggle for political independence was rooted in our peoples' desire to be free
Countryname: but it was nurtured and strengthened right here
Region: in the corridors of the United Nations
Continent: by the overwhelming support we received from the international community.

Countrycode: It is not surprising
Latitude: then
Longitude: that the Constitution of Belize affirms principles of universality - principles that acknowledge the supremacy of God
Text: faith in human rights and fundamental freedoms
Totalmentions: and the dignity of the human person. Such principles translate into respect for the sovereignty of other nations
Countryname: the right to self-determination of peoples
Region: and non-interference in the internal affairs of other countries. We take this opportunity to congratulate the President on his appointment to that high office. The world community looks to him - an accomplished son of Africa - with great expectancy and hope. We express to the Secretary-General
Continent: Mr. Javier Perez de Cuellar  our deep appreciation and recognition of his tireless efforts in promoting peace and the noble objectives of our Organization.

Countrycode: This year
Latitude: the forty-fourth session of the General Assembly opened in a spirit of optimism. The present atmosphere is one of reduced international tension. The ideological forces that have polarized the world for half a century are diminishing. We see a universal movement of people - people everywhere - in search of freedom and democratic participation.

Countrycode: It is a time of momentous change and transformation. There is a growing recognition of the imperative to manage the world's resources in the interests of the global family. While all this is taking place
Latitude: issues like environmental degradation
Longitude: acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (ANDS) and drug abuse have joined the scourge of poverty as priority issues on the international agenda - doing so in ways that underline how interdependent nations and people have become. The achievements in the political sphere are in stark contrast to persistent economic problems facing many developing com tries. In the Latin American and Caribbean region
Text: the massive debt problem
Totalmentions: flight of capital
Countryname: decline in trade and investment
Region: and the growing disparity between the rich and the poor have resulted in many countries suffering reverses in the decade of the 19803.

Countrycode: Reducing poverty and revitalizing growth is the challenge of our time. As we begin the new decade
Latitude: the task ahead is clear. The development agenda for the 1990s must be to harness growth and use resources creatively to improve the quality of life of all our people. If we are to achieve a high quality of growth and development
Longitude: our Governments must make better use of the resources. This calls for sound public financial and fiscal responsibility. We must find better ways for public expenditure to complement and spur private production
Text: not displace it and we must provide the essential social infrastructure in education
Totalmentions: health and housing to benefit the many
Countryname: not divert scarce resources to luxuries for a select
Region: privileged few. We must bring the informal workers into the regular economy and allow individual enterprise to flourish.

Countrycode: But this will not happen by itself. There is need for concerted action in a new dynamic partnership where people elect Governments and Governments empower people to solve their own problems and take control of their lives. For this to happen
Latitude: we must launch a new era in education to equip our young people with the knowledge
Longitude: skills and attitudes they require to take an active role in the development process.

Countrycode: Such pragmatic efforts at the national level will
Latitude: however
Longitude: be frustrated if the international economic environment is not conducive to development. While we in the developing countries must carry the primary responsibility for our future
Text: the industrialized world has a vital part to play - not just in providing external resources and the transfer of technology
Totalmentions: but also in ensuring that the developing countries have easy access to their markets.

Countrycode: The time has come to address the pressing imbalances in the world economy. We have repeatedly acknowledged that peace and development are inextricably bound. Indeed  it is true saying that development is another name for peace
Latitude: or
Longitude: as others have put it
Text: that economic freedom and political freedom are essential and inseparable considerations on the read to national prosperity. The one will not long survive without the other.

Countrycode: Because of this vital connection between politics and economics in ' Id of global interdependence
Latitude: the special session of the United Nations devoted to international economic co-operation to be convened in April 1990 takes on added importance. Of special concern is the growing trend in the industrialized world toward protectionism. The economic integration of Europe poses new realities for many of our countries in Africa
Longitude: the Caribbean and the Pacific - the ACP Group. Cur economies are open and vulnerable not only to the ravages of hurricanes but also to the man-made disasters resulting from arbitrary decisions in the boardrooms of the industrialized world which distort the levels of commodity prices.

Countrycode: Such vulnerability and fragility make it all the more imperative that we put our own houses in order. We have tried to do that in Belize. Working in accordance with the process of democratic choice
Latitude: the people of Belize
Longitude: in the second national elections since our independence eight years ago
Text: decided to replace its Government after one term in office. Belizeans arrived at a consensus to take charge once again of their political
Totalmentions: social and economic future in a compassionate and productive atmosphere in which Belizeans come first
Countryname: l ensure this
Region: they elected to government a majority of the candidates of the People's United Party
Continent: the political movement that with the support of the people and the backing of the international community led Belize to independence in 1981.

Countrycode: Independence brought with it the promise of development
Latitude: of more opportunity
Longitude: peace and stability. Good government delivers and makes possible the attainment by the people of a better standard of living and a higher quality of life. The dynamics of development impel us to give highest priority to that assurance of human dignity - the creation of jobs.

Countrycode: My Government
Latitude: therefore
Longitude: continues to welcome investors from abroad who
Text: with their capital
Totalmentions: technology and access to new markets can join Belizeans in expanding trade and providing increased export earnings and economic activity. Those investors are our partners in development
Countryname: who will participate with Belizeans in the mixed economy
Region: assuring jobs at decent wages while at the same time benefiting from the climate of free and fair competition of a socially just market economy.

Countrycode: In accordance with the principle of the peaceful settlement of disputes
Latitude: it is heartening to note the current constructive efforts now under way aimed at achieving the peace that has eluded our region for so long. The present political climate now renders the military option obsolete in resolving the embittered tensions that for ages have remained a major obstacle to international peace and security.

Countrycode: The community of nations has reiterated deserved recognition of the far-sighted and unfailing determination of the Contadora process in its conviction that the peoples of Central America wish to achieve peace
Latitude: reconciliation
Longitude: development  id justice without interference
Text: in accordance with their own decisions and historical experience.

Countrycode: The recent signing of the historic Tela agreement between five Central American Presidents is the latest example of the region's commitment to fulfilling the undertakings assumed under the Eequipulas procedure in search of a firm and lasting peace. That joint plan for the voluntary demobilization
Latitude: repatriation or relocation of the Nicaraguan resistance is hailed as a singular achievement of the Central American peace process
Longitude: which seeks national reconciliation and democratization.

Countrycode: Belize maintains its commitment to peaceful coexistence and harmony with all our neighbours. Over the past year Belize and Guatemala have continued the negotiating process aimed at the conclusion of a possible draft of a comprehensive treaty to afford a just and lasting determination of the controversy. We stand ready to resume these discussions with a renewed spirit of goodwill
Longitude: without compromising the sovereignty
Text: independence and territorial integrity of Belize.

Countrycode: The continued support of our sister Caribbean countries
Latitude: the Commonwealth of Nations and the Non-Aligned Movement
Longitude: as well as the solidarity and understanding of out Latin American neighbours
Text: gives us confidence that the reality of our two sovereign nations living as good neighbours will find universal acceptance.

Countrycode: In a similar vein we applaud the announcement of the renewal of negotiations between the United Kingdom and Argentina over the Falkland Islands
Latitude: recalling our own struggle
Longitude: we exhort our Argentine friends to refrain from any action that might be prejudicial to the Interests of the Falklands or compromise their inalienable right to self-determination.

Countrycode: My Government continues to be seriously concerned at the erosion of the constitutional process and the denial to the people of Panama of their right freely to elect a Government of their choice. The decision of the military leadership to annul elections and subsequently impose a president of its own choosing as Head of State of Panama further isolates that country in the international community.

The friendship and co-operation between the peoples of Belize and Panama have a long history and it Is the wish of ray Government that this relationship should continue. We recall the solidarity demonstrated by Panama during Belize's struggle for independence and the pivotal role played by the late Panamian leader General Torrijos towards the achievement of Belizean independence.

We call on the current leadership in Panama to co-operate in national and regional efforts to establish the framework for a return to democracy and constitutional rule in Panama and to put in place mechanisms for early and fair elections.

The success of democracy is inevitable  as is now being proved in several parts of the world. We invite the leadership in Haiti to take certain steps on the path to democracy to demonstrate its commitment to early elections and transition to democratic rule and we ask all sectors of Haitian society to co-operate in this important process.
We now focus attention once more on the illicit traffic in narcotic drugs. The magnitude of this global problem
Latitude: in addition to its economic and social consequences
Longitude: has now become a major national security concern for many nations in our region. At home in Belize we are committed to launching a concerted drive to eradicate the drug problem and to join forces in regional and international actions to put an end to this menace to society.

Countrycode: While the cultivation and use of marijuana in Belize have abated considerably
Latitude: we recognize a new danger stemming from the growing use of crack and cocaine
Longitude: as well as the use of our territory as a trans-shipment point for illegal drugs. In the face of these problems my Government proposes to work in collaboration with friendly Governments at the interdiction level to eliminate this serious threat to our country. We also recognize that if the use of illegal drugs in our society is to be eliminated  the problem must be addressed as an education issue as well. We will therefore shortly be launching a major campaign using all available resources in our educational system to focus national attention on the inherent dangers associated with the use of illicit drugs. We also plan to establish a drug rehabilitation centre and welcome international support in this endeavour.

Countrycode: We wish to record our support for the related proposal of our sister Caribbean Community (CARICCK) State of Jamaica
Latitude: which calls for the establishment of a multinational anti-drug task force within the United Nations system. This is a welcome opportunity for countries to pool their resources and intelligence capabilities against the well-organized
Longitude: well-financed
Text: and better-equipped drug cartels. And we can do so without infringing on the sovereignty of any nation.

Countrycode: Despite some progress and relaxation of political tensions in conflicts on the continent
Latitude: the minority white racist Pretoria regime continues its intransigence
Longitude: oppressing and exploiting the already dispossessed black majority in South Africa. The apartheid policy of this terrorist settler rule administration remains today as the glaring obstacle in the path of peace
Text: stability and development in that region. Belize does not entertain notions that apartheid
Totalmentions: as a crime against humanity
Countryname: can be reformed. We insist on the total eradication of all vestiges of this system
Region: which is an affront to any standard of human dignity. Belize continues to associate itself with those who are committed to keeping up the relentless pressure on South Africa until our brothers and sisters eventually triumph using all possible means in their just and legitimate struggle.

Countrycode: On Namibia
Latitude: we trust that the Security Council will lend its full weight to ensuring that South Africa proceeds to disband all its paramilitary and commando units which still threaten the implementation of political progress towards Independence. Even at this late stage
Longitude: the international community must remain vigilant to ensure that South Africa does not succeed in subverting the process towards democratic elections in Namibia.

Countrycode: Belize recognizes the urgency of achieving a just and comprehensive settlement of the Arab-Israeli conflict
Latitude: the core of which is the question of Palestine. No just and lasting peace can be achieved in the Middle East until the legitimate rights of the Palestinian people are recognized
Longitude: including their right to self-determination and a homeland
Text: without compromising Israel's security. At a time when the Palestinian leadership under Chairman Yasser Arafat is offering important peace initiatives
Totalmentions: my delegation looks forward to the early convening of the International Peace Conference on the Middle East under the auspices of the United Nations
Countryname: with the participation of the Palestine Liberation Organization and all parties on an equal footing.

Countrycode: In the case of Lebanon
Latitude: it is our hope that the current cease-fire will be respected by all the parties concerned and that Lebanon will be given the opportunity to recover from the destruction and violence which has occurred. All Lebanon wants is to be left alone so that it can find Lebanese solutions to Lebanese problems. Outside interference can only hinder this.

Countrycode: The global issue which today holds centre stage is the environment. In the coming decade
Latitude: the world must deal much more effectively with problems resulting from the degradation of the environment acid rain
Longitude: ocean pollution
Text: nuclear and toxic waste
Totalmentions: ozone depletion and climate change. Industrial countries account for over 75 per cent of carbon dioxide emissions
Countryname: the main cause of global warming. Clearly
Region: therefore
Continent: the major responsibility to reduce emissions rests there.

Countrycode: Belize has its own concerns our rain forests
Latitude: our coral reef system and our flora and fauna are gifts of God which we have a duty to protect for generations of Belizeans yet unborn. We are committed to protecting Belize's natural resources and environment to maintain a harmonious ecological balance
Longitude: but we must take a holistic approach to the environmental challenge. We must promote and protect the environmental qualities of life in the fullest sense by extending economic choice and opportunities
Text: for poverty is the ultimate environmental degradation. A fundamental environmental task for the decade ahead is the promotion of sustainable agriculture to feed our people. We must meet the growing environmental challenge by expanding economic freedom. True and lasting economic development must necessarily include maintaining ecological balance.

Countrycode: Our societies in the third world are undergoing serious strains in the care of children and in guaranteeing women equal opportunities in education and employment. Our ability as a people to provide the values and ideals that will guide the next generation will determine the course of social realities in the twenty-first century. As a policy
Latitude: the Government of Belize supports public and private initiatives in the promotion and defence of human rights
Longitude: and particularly

Countrycode: the rights of the child and of women. As soon as it is practicable
Latitude: Belize will accede to and ratify the convention on the rights of the child and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women
Longitude: end give practical effect to them by force of law.

Countrycode: All this requires action new. The future is now. We can promote political freedom if we also promote economic freedom. We can aim for a high quality of growth while at the same time providing for the equitable distribution of the fruits of growth. We can achieve greater productivity and expanded trade if we liberate the creative energies of out people and remove the barriers to an interdependent global economy. If we do act effectively together
Latitude: we may be able to look back on this time as a turning point in building a more peaceful and just world - a new world
Longitude: a far better world - one in which the eternal dignity of man is respected.

Countrycode: FRA
Text: ï»¿I am speaking on behalf of the European Economic Community. Mr. President
Totalmentions: allow me in my turn to extend to you on behalf of the European Community and its member States warmest congratulations on your unanimous election to the office of President of the General Assembly. Your experience in international affairs
Countryname: your perfect familiarity with the United Nations system and your personal qualities particularly qualify you to occupy that important office. We have no doubt that those attributes will enable you to work wonders.

Countrycode: Let me also include in this tribute your predecessor at the head of the Assembly
Latitude: Mr. Dante Caputo. The energy and efficiency with which he discharged that office merit the gratitude of the entire Organization.

Countrycode: I should like also
Latitude: on behalf of the Twelve
Longitude: to assure the Secretary-General of our unswerving and unqualified support in his weighty task
Text: and to express our admiration for his untiring activity throughout the world in favour of peace.

Countrycode: The European Community and its member States have always considered that they have a special contribution to make to the efforts being made to build a more just and peaceful world bound by ever-closer ties of solidarity.
I should now like to put forward a few thoughts about the main thrust of our external action
Latitude: by pointing to our common struggle for peace
Longitude: the outlook for economic development and the fight against the scourges inflicted on our societies by human rights violations
Text: terrorism and drug abuse.

Countrycode: I should like first to say a few words about the hopes that have been kindled by developments in the year gone by. while the progress made is still too fragile for the international community to be certain that it will soon see the dawn of peace break upon the world
Latitude: and while tensions still exist or are worsening here and there and indeed new conflicts are emerging
Longitude: the fact is that
Text: all in all
Totalmentions: the cause of peace has advanced more than it probably ever has done in recent times.

Countrycode: In relations between the eastern and western parts of Europe
Latitude: recent developments suggest that the deep wounds of history
Longitude: once considered as incurable
Text: are now beginning to heal. On both sides
Totalmentions: a common language is enabling us to talk to one another
Countryname: negotiate and reach agreements that only a short time ago seemed beyond our grasp.

Countrycode: The European Council has sought to give fresh impetus to East-West relations
Latitude: as this is warranted by the changes towards greater political and economic freedom that have taken place in the Soviet Union and several Central and Eastern European countries
Longitude: notably Poland and Hungary. While we must regret that there remain serious violations of human rights in some of those countries
Text: how could we fail to welcome the reforms on which they have embarked and support and encourage them when they are quite plainly contributing to overcoming the divisions of the last War at a pace and on a scale hitherto unprecedented in Europe.

Countrycode: The proceedings of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe are closely bound up with that prospect. Since the adoption of a closing document last January in Vienna
Latitude: two key meetings - the Information Forum in London and the first session of the Conference on the Human Dimension in Paris - have made it possible to take greater advantage of the scope of the Helsinki process to advance the cause of fundamental freedoms
Longitude: the rule of law and the values of democracy.

Countrycode: As for the negotiations on measures aimed at building confidence and security and on conventional forces in Europe
Latitude: whose purpose is to remove the imbalances liable to undermine the stability and security of the continent
Longitude: they have taken a decisive turn
Text: and there are hopes that in the coming months significant progress can be made which would have major importance for the future of East-West relations.

Countrycode: In the broader setting of the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva
Latitude: there have been encouraging results following the impetus created by the Conference on chemical disarmament held in Paris in January 1989. The Twelve would like to see the conclusion at the earliest possible opportunity of a comprehensive
Longitude: verifiable treaty banning chemical weapons. The results achieved in that field at the recent United States-Soviet meetings are a most encouraging sign in this respect.

Countrycode: By the same token
Latitude: I welcome the progress announced yesterday by the President of the United states and moments ago by the Soviet Foreign Minister with regard to their bilateral negotiations on reducing by half their stockpiles of strategic weapons. We hope there will be an early outcome to these negotiations and that the significant gains of the past
Longitude: such as the anti-ballistic missile Treaty
Text: will be preserved.

Countrycode: But Europe is not the only theatre in the struggle for peace
Latitude: to which our Organization attaches universal significance. Encouraging signs have emerged in many parts of the world
Longitude: holding out promise of the settlement of some conflicts. The utmost must be done to give added impetus to those favourable develops
Text: and the Twelve are setting about that task.

Countrycode: In Namibia
Latitude: the process towards independence and peace is under way. The twelve unreservedly support the action of the Secretary-General and earnestly call on all the parties not to impede the movement towards peace. The European community stands ready to welcome an independent Namibia among its partners under the Lome Convention.

Countrycode: The rewarding dialogue started with the front-line States
Latitude: notably in Luxembourg last June
Longitude: shows that everyone aspires to an early settlement of these long-standing conflicts which have delayed or thwarted the region's development plans. Here again
Text: the Community is more than ready to foster reconstruction and
Totalmentions: whether it be in Angola
Countryname: Mozambique or elsewhere
Region: to help the population build a new era of peace.

Countrycode: In that connection
Latitude: the Community and its member States have always insisted on the need to put an end to the apartheid system and bring about the establishment of a just
Longitude: democratic society in South Africa. I shall come back to that basic demand.

Countrycode: The Twelve are particularly attentive to the implementation of the Secretary-General's peace plan for Western Sahara
Latitude: which is expected to lead to a referendum on self-determination and holds out hopes for a settlement of this issue. They are convinced that the creation of the Arab Maghreb Union will contribute to that end.

Countrycode: Through the recent Tela agreements

The success of the exercise will depend on the different parties abiding by the undertakings they have given. It is also envisaged that the United Nations and the Organization of American States (OAS) will lend their support to the implementation of the peace agreements.

Countrycode: The Community and its member States wish to pay a tribute to the sense of moderation and dialogue displayed by the Central American Heads of State
Latitude: moved as they have been by the spirit of democracy. The San Pedro Sula Conference
Longitude: held in February 1989
Text: showed the determination of the European Community and the Contadora group of countries to give their support to the process of negotiation and economic integration which the Central American Governments have set as their goals.

Countrycode: The Twelve also note with satisfaction the progress made by democracy in South
America
Latitude: and especially the prospect of positive developments in Chile
Longitude: heralded by free elections.

Latitude: which was welcomed by the entire international community
Longitude: the Secretary-General has
Text: with the Twelve's support
Totalmentions: pursued his endeavours to ensure that the negotiations move progressively towards a final settlement. But we should not be content with the current 'no war - no peace' situation. The Twelve accordingly wish to launch an appeal to the Governments of the two countries to contribute to the efforts of the

Countrycode: Secretary-General and his colleagues to transform the present armistice into a lasting peace and to lose no more time in fully implementing Security Council resolution 598 (1987).

The Twelve express the hope that the Iranian leaders will demonstrate their readiness to contribute to international life in a constructive and peaceful manner consonant with the norms governing relations among States
Latitude: so that that country can again take its rightful place in its region and in the international community at large.

Countrycode: The withdrawal of Soviet troops from Afghanistan was a necessary
Latitude: but not sufficient
Longitude: condition for a political solution. As long as the conflict continues
Text: there will still be a need for all the Afghan parties to seek ways and means of bringing about a genuine process of self-determination
Totalmentions: leading to the formation of a fully representative government and the existence of a truly independent and non-aligned Afghanistan. The Twelve confirm their support for the United Nations Secretary-General in the efforts he is making to facilitate a settlement
Countryname: in the hope that the refugees will be able to return to their homes in freedom and dignity
Region: the Community and its member States stand ready
Continent: once a settlement has been reached
column9: to contribute to the reconstruction of Afghanistan
column10: in the same way as they are already contributing to the humanitarian assistance being provided for the long-suffering people of that country.

Countrycode: In Cambodia
Latitude: signs have emerged in recent months
Longitude: albeit tentatively
Text: of a possible return to peace. The Twelve have welcomed the decision of Viet Nam to withdraw its troops and consider that their withdrawal has made it possible to seek an overall political solution to the Cambodian conflict. The Twelve's support could not but encourage France to take the initiative of convening an international conference in Paris
Totalmentions: with the co-presidency of Indonesia
Countryname: bringing together all the

Countrycode: Khmer parties and the countries most directly involved
Latitude: in the presence of the UN Secretary General. Although the meeting did not make it possible to reach an agreement
Longitude: it can be said to have marked a very important turning point in the search for a peaceful solution. The process which has now started should be pursued
Text: with the requisite determination
Totalmentions: with the aim of arriving at least at an overall settlement guaranteeing the independence
Countryname: sovereignty
Region: territorial integrity and neutrality of Cambodia and enabling the Cambodian people to control its own destiny through free end internationally supervised elections. The temptation of the different parties involved to seek a solution in the field still by force of arms could lead only to a stalemate.

Countrycode: The Twelve are convinced that the only way out of this long-drawn-out conflict lies in dialogue and national reconciliation. The continuing instability in that region is also adding to the tragedy of the Vietnamese boat people. The Twelve share the determination of the Secretary-General and the international community to find a solution to this problem. In the case of the Korean peninsula. we should like again to voice the hope that
Latitude: in accordance with the principle of universality enshrined in our Organization
Longitude: the Korean people may enjoy full representation in the United Nations at an early date.

Countrycode: The progress that has been accomplished and the stronger conviction we now have that peace is possible everywhere can only strengthen our resolve to work the Middle East. In the Middle East at a time when
Latitude: on the Palestinian  side
Longitude: a number of important decisions have opened up fresh prospects for a realistic search for a settlement of the Israeli conflict and the Palestinian question
Text: no real progress has yet been made in responding to those moves. Yet the passage of time is not working to anybody's advantage. Let us beware of the disappointment that is bound to be aroused by such missed opportunities.

Countrycode: The Community is making the same message plain to one and all: if a peace settlement is to be reached
Latitude: then it is necessary to recognize
Longitude: both in the Middle East and elsewhere in the world
Text: the right of all States
Totalmentions: and of Israel in particular
Countryname: to security and the right of all peoples to justice - in other words
Region: the right of the Palestinian people to self-determination
Continent: with everything which that implies. In the Community's view
column9: the appropriate way to attain those goals remains the organization of an international peace conference under the auspices of the United Nations.

Countrycode: The situation in the occupied territories provides a dramatic illustration of the effects of the lack of progress in seeking a settlement. The measures taken against the population in those territories - the continued closure of the universities
Latitude: the expulsions
Longitude: the extension and increase in the number of detentions on administrative grounds - have prompted the Twelve to appeal yet again to the Israeli authorities to abide by their obligations as the occupying Power
Text: in accordance with the Security Council resolutions.

Countrycode: The Twelve
Latitude: in the Madrid Declaration
Longitude: have made their position known on the Israeli plan for organizing elections and granting provisional self-governing status to the territories. For the impact of such elections to be really meaningful
Text: they should form part of a comprehensive settlement process based on Security Council resolutions 242 (1967) and 338 (1973) and the application of the principle of land for peace
Totalmentions: and they should be held with adequate guarantees of freedom throughout the occupied territories
Countryname: including East Jerusalem. In the same spirit and on the basis of the same principles
Region: the Twelve welcome Egypt's contribution to the peace process
Continent: as set out in the 10 Points  which President Mubarak has Put forward. The Twelve hope that this will

Countrycode: make it possible
Latitude: in particular
Longitude: to set in motion the necessary dialogue between Israelis and Palestinians.

Countrycode: Without waiting for the settlement which
Latitude: they so earnestly desire
Longitude: the Community and its member states plan to step up their cooperation with the occupied territories and to develop their program of assistance to the population
Text: which has suffered so severely from the continuing occupation and its attendant restrictions.

Countrycode: I now  wish to refer to Lebanon. In Lebanon
Latitude: the tragedy of a nation that has been torn apart has lasted for 14 years now. Never has the suffering been so great as over the past few months
Longitude: nor the battles so bloody
Text: nor the ordeals borne by everybody so horrendous.

Countrycode: It is this that has prompted the Community and its Member States to call for an effective cease-fire and the lifting of the blockades and for a start to be made towards a process of national reconciliation ensuring the full restoration of Lebanese sovereignty on the basis of fresh institutions. They have constantly given their support to the moves made by the Arab League
Latitude: which were initially led by the Committee of Six and subsequently by that of the three Heads of State. They welcome that top-level Committee's resumption of its mission
Longitude: which they fully support
Text: and hope that once the parties have all agreed to its proposals
Totalmentions: dialogue and the quest for peace will prevail.

Countrycode: It is now essential that
Latitude: at a moment when dialogue is being renewed
Longitude: all Lebanese parties be freed from external pressures so that they may be able to agree on a new system for living side by side
Text: one that takes into account the existing demographic and social situation. Through the introduction of such a system and the withdrawal of all foreign forces - with the exception of the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL) - Lebanon must regain its full sovereignty
Totalmentions: independence
Countryname: unity and territorial integrity.

Countrycode: This is what France has been endeavouring to do
Latitude: and will continue to do with the support of its partners in the Community
Longitude: while making it its constant concern to support the Arab moves led by the Tripartite Committee until hope is rekindled in Lebanon.

Countrycode: At the same time the Community and its member States have signified their solidarity with the entire Lebanese people by undertaking an assistance programme aimed at alleviating their suffering and at contributing to the restoration of normal living conditions and the resumption of economic and social activities.
We cannot speak of Lebanon without referring to the fate of the hostages
Latitude: several of whom are nationals of the Community's member States. How can we forget Colonel Higgins
Longitude: who was serving the United Nations? The Twelve condemn the taking of hostages
Text: which must be fought with all the means at our disposal in the spirit of the relevant resolutions adopted by the Security Council. The Twelve wish to appeal to those countries which might be able to exert some influence in secure the liberation of the hostages.

Countrycode: I should like to state the Community's unchanging position with regard to Cyprus
Latitude: a member of the European family. The Twelve call on all the parties to co-operate with the Secretary-General and his Representative on the spot with a view to overcoming the existing obstacles and finding the paths to dialogue. The Twelve ask them not to let slip the opportunity now available for a just and lasting settlement that will safeguard the independence
Longitude: sovereignty
Text: territorial integrity and unity of Cyprus in accordance with the relevant resolutions of the United Nations.

Countrycode: We all know that world peace is a sacred cause. It warrants all the energy and resolve we can devote to it. It calls for determination and obstinacy. We may. no doubt
Latitude: feel rather discouraged when no sooner has one hotbed of tension died down than others flare up
Longitude: for we are then dogged by feelings of hopelessness
Text: like those which Sisyphus may be felt at the top of his mountain before the stone started to roll down again.

Countrycode: And yet
Latitude: hope remains alive when the chain of men and women epitomized by our Assembly are still linked together in the service of peace. We know that that unremitting task is a collective one and that progress cannot be made unless we are all mobilized.

Countrycode: Hence it is with the same determination
Latitude: the same degree of hope and the same trust in good fortune that we have to tackle other conflicts and other areas of tension
Longitude: evidence of further rifts here and there.

Countrycode: I should here like to turn to the case of those two countries
Latitude: Senegal and Mauritania
Longitude: which were living in harmony and united by a common design
Text: but which have suddenly been rocked by violence to the point where they have now become brother enemies. Can Senegal and Mauritania soon return to the path of understanding and dialogue? The Twelve earnestly hope so. This is why they are supporting the mediation efforts of President Mubarak and hope that conciliation and reason will prevail.

Countrycode: Other tragedies are being played out. In Ethiopia
Latitude: where the civil war continues to rage bringing in its wake a host of displaced populations
Longitude: suffering and poverty
Text: prospects for dialogue seem nevertheless to be emerging. The Twelve hope to do all they can to pave the way for negotiation and reconciliation. The same holds true for the Sudan and Somalia.

Countrycode: In this connexion I should like to pay a tribute to the action of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
Latitude: whose work everyone considers irreplaceable.

Countrycode: Lastly
Latitude: I should like to mention the hopes aroused by the discussions between the Governments at Colombo and New Delhi in a bid to restore peace and national unity in Sri Lanka.

Countrycode: In the case of East Timor
Latitude: the Twelve reaffirm their support for the contacts between Portugal and Indonesia under the auspices of the Secretary-General. They hope that early progress will lead to a just and comprehensive settlement
Longitude: accepted internationally.

Countrycode: The cause of peace is making progress in spite of everything
Latitude: as we can see
Longitude: and our Assembly bears special witness to the fact. It is making progress through multilateral and bilateral dialogue
Text: through the readiness of States to renounce war in settling their differences
Totalmentions: and through the action of the United Nations in every instance where its mediation is imperative. The Twelve intend to associate themselves fully with this ever renewed task and they will play a major role in quelling conflicts
Countryname: by reasons
Region: I would say
Continent: of their very nature and calling
column9: and through the example they are setting through the agreement among them and their prospective union.

Countrycode: Yet peace-making
Latitude: the reduction of tensions and the banishment of violence cannot be dissociated from the struggle against the inequalities marking international economic development. We must take care - I say again - not to provoke new trouble spots that might be stirred up by the revolt of the poor. We must make sure that growth world-wide is shared more fairly and is more balanced and more geared to coping with the abject poverty of those countries which have few natural endowments or which have been ill-treated by history or crushed by the burden of debt. Action in favour of growth and development is
Longitude: more than ever
Text: an integral part of the struggle for peace. The Community has made that fact a key feature of its relations with the rest of the world.

Countrycode: Since the beginning of the 1980s
Latitude: economic growth has recovered and has brought about a sharp increase in trade. Our aim is to consolidate that trend while at the same time continuing the struggle against inflation and unemployment. We have to ensure that everybody benefits from the movement. The fact that whole regions
Longitude: in particular in Africa and Latin America
Text: are continuing to lag behind

Countrycode: would reduce all efforts to naught if priority were not given to North-South solidarity.
As the world's foremost trading power and its leading provider of aid
Latitude: the European Community considers that tangible steps have to be taken in the three key areas of international economic co-operation
Longitude: development and the environment
Text: about which I shall now say a few words.

Countrycode: In recent years Europe
Latitude: together with Japan and a number of other Asian partners
Longitude: has progressively taken over the momentum formerly generated by growth in the United States. Such growth is healthy and is the outcome of efforts of investment and modernization and the determined and convergent action of member States to hold down inflation and
Text: above all
Totalmentions: to finalize the establishment of the internal market by 1993.

Countrycode: This internal market will not be self-contained. The Europe of 1993 will be a 'Europe of partners'. The programme for finalizing the creation of the internal market will not entail any weakening of the Community's international obligations. All its multilateral or bilateral commitments are and will be respected. It is in our very interest to preserve and encourage a free and open trading system.
All Europe's partners will benefit from the single market of 1993 as a result of the dismantling of frontiers
Latitude: the improvement of access procedures and the greater degree of transparency. The economic growth generated by the merger of 12 markets into a single market of 320 million consumers will work to the advantage of everybody when it is borne in mind that imports
Longitude: which already account for one quarter of its gross domestic product
Text: are expected to progress even further.

Countrycode: In more specific areas
Latitude: the efforts deployed by the Community at the internal level will also have positive effects for third countries. For instance
Longitude: the progressive accomplishment of economic and monetary union - which will be one of our major priorities in the coming months - will be instrumental in contributing to the stability of the international monetary system.

Countrycode: The reform of the Common Agricultural Policy
Latitude: on which work started five years ago
Longitude: is continuing
Text: it is contributing to the improvement of the world market situation. The Co-unity reaffirms the undertakings it gave at the mid-term meeting of the Uruguay Round negotiations in April 1989. The efforts it is making

Countrycode: are considerable
Latitude: and I would recall that it remains the world's largest importer of agricultural products.

Countrycode: In 1989 the Community has continued to strengthen its relations with all the regions of the world. First
Latitude: it is making preparations with the European Free Trade Association for a renewed framework for dialogue and co-operation. Then
Longitude: a series of agreements have been concluded with the countries of Eastern Europe: with Hungary
Text: Czechoslovakia and
Totalmentions: even more recently
Countryname: with Poland
Region: to which Commissioner Adriessen and myself paid a visit. Developments in this last-named country make it increasingly urgent to dispatch the aid that was decided on at the Summit of the Arch and accepted by 24 countries. We must force the pace to respond to the extent of the need.

Countrycode: Negotiations are being conducted with the Soviet Union and Bulgaria
Latitude: and are being envisaged with the German Democratic Republic. This is the basis on which the Community plans to engage in a variety of forms of co-operation to supplement that in which its member States are already engaging.

Countrycode: The creation of the Arab Maghreb Union will enable the European Economic to step up and diversify the already very rewarding relations it maintains with those Mediterranean countries. Discussions are proceeding with the countries of the Gulf Cooperation Council for the purpose of supplementing the Cooperation Agreed signed in 1988 by means Of a fresh trade agreement.
In Asia
Latitude: 1989 has been a year marked by new joint steps taken by the EEC and the Association of South-East Asian Nations (ASEAN
Longitude: in their bid to further industrial cooperation by stepping up investments. With its Latin American partners
Text: the Community is pursuing its efforts to diversify cooperation and trade. in Central America
Totalmentions: it is developing it cooperation under the San Jose Agreements
Countryname: thereby enhancing the efforts being made by the countries of the isthmus.

Countrycode: Lastly
Latitude: I should like to express my deep satisfaction at the improvement in the Community's trade relations with its main partners in the developed world
Longitude: where willingness to negotiate is now the overriding consideration.

Countrycode: This improvement in the climate is fragile
Latitude: and our best chance of consolidating it is to complete the Uruguay Round negotiations by the date scheduled and to secure substantive results in all areas.

Countrycode: In the coming months
Latitude: North-South solidarity will be in the international headlines: the renewal of the lome Convention
Longitude: the special session of the United Nations General Assembly on economic cooperation and development
Text: the second international conference on the least developed countries in Paris
Totalmentions: and the launching of the fourth development decade.

Countrycode: Let us grasp the opportunity offered by these various occasions
Latitude: for they will make it possible to take stock of what has been achieved and also to realize that we need to go further. Development depends to a large degree on the domestic strategies adopted by the countries concerned themselves. A large number of developing countries have embarked on a courageous adjustment process that is an essential requirement
Longitude: even though it may sometimes give rise to problems from the social and political standpoints. I wish to pay tribute to their efforts which often demand heavy sacrifices.

Countrycode: However
Latitude: these efforts will be useful only if they are made in a favourable international environment. In the first place
Longitude: it is absolutely essential to lighten the burden of excessive indebtedness which has now become intolerable. In this crucial area
Text: the concerted and constructive approach that has prevailed has already made it possible to overcome the inhibiting factors and to record some measure of progress.

Countrycode: Several of the Community's  member States have taken additional steps in favour of the poorest countries by cancelling official development assistance loans. France
Latitude: for its part
Longitude: has announced through the President of the Republic an across-the-board cancellation of the debts accruing from development assistance in the case of 35 of the poorest African entries. This measure will come into force on 1 January 1990 and is - I must say here - free of any conditions.

Countrycode: At the same time
Latitude: other countries which are certainly not as poor but which are grappling with a heavy burden of indebtedness to the banks are having to face difficult political and economic choices. This is particularly the case in Latin America where solving the debt problem should make it possible to consolidate and strengthen democracy in the region.

Countrycode: Two countries
Latitude: Mexico and the Philippines
Longitude: have already successfully embarked on that path. But progress in coping with indebtedness cannot be sufficient in itself to ensure development
Text: and fresh resources are necessary. Such resources must
Totalmentions: in the first instance
Countryname: be generated by trade. The Community has already
Region: to a large extent
Continent: opened up its market to products from the developing countries
column9: without awaiting the conclusion of the Uruguay Round
column10: it has recently made significant improvements in the access of tropical products to its market.

Countrycode: In the ongoing renegotiation of the Lome Convention
Latitude: it will endeavour to improve further an arrangement that is already proving advantageous. Even so
Longitude: for the vast majority of the developing countries
Text: dependent as they are on a handful of export comities
Totalmentions: access to the markets of the industrialized countries is not enough. The Common Fund for commodities
Countryname: should now come into force. For its part
Region: the Community plans to strengthen the STABEX and SYSMIN mechanisms for the stabilization of export earnings under the Lome Convention.

Countrycode: Alongside these measures
Latitude: official development assistance still represents a lifeline
Longitude: and the Community is already making a considerable effort in that regard. The assistance proved by its member States taken together has been quite clearly moving in the direction of the 0.7 per cent target since the early 1980s.

Countrycode: In the final analysis
Latitude: however
Longitude: economic development hinges on an unfailing international mobilization of forces to protect our environment. The heating up of the atmosphere
Text: the deterioration of the ozone layer
Totalmentions: the pollution of the oceans and freshwater resources and desertification - all pose a threat to our entire planet.

Countrycode: Contending with this threat at an early date is a responsibility that is incumbent upon all of us.

Many developing countries do not always have sufficient funds for that purpose. An effort by the industrialized countries to introduce new forms of co-operation and financing will make it easier for the individual countries in the world to take care of the environment and to manage their natural resources in a common endeavour. This must surely be one of the most necessary forms that international solidarity can take.
Such solidarity is exemplary when it takes the form of protecting the tropical forests
Latitude: helping Bangladesh to combat the incalculable consequences of flooding
Longitude: or setting up an observatory in the Sahara.

Countrycode: The planetary scale of the threat is such that international negotiations are needed to spell out the objectives of common interest.
With that prospect in mind
Latitude: the conference on the environment and development
Longitude: which the United Nations Secretary-General is convening in 1992
Text: will represent a major turning-point. Before then
Totalmentions: the world climate conference which will take place in 1990 should afford an opportunity for making significant progress on the question of the greenhouse effect. The Community earnestly calls for the conclusion of an international agreement on climatic changes
Countryname: and it would also like a dialogue to be started on ocean-bed mining. The Community has already taken
Region: or is about to take
Continent: a number of decisions having immediate effects the early implementation
column9: and at a faster pace
column10: of the Helsinki decisions on the eradication of chlorofluorocarbons; the launching of a programme of action on the greenhouse effect; accession to the Basle Convention on movements of dangerous waste; the creation of a European environmental agency and the drawing-up of a tropical forest assistance programme.

Countrycode: These actions
Latitude: coupled with support for the current international negotiations and with the integration of environmental issues into co-operation with the developing countries
Longitude: are indicative of the Community's growing commitment to the preservation of our planetary environment.

Countrycode: There are other threats that also call for our vigilance and decisive action. We likewise cannot keep silent at the violations of mankind's most fundamental freedoms and rights. There are many such violations and they unfortunately continue to exist in too many countries on all the continents.
The Twelve are constantly waging war on behalf of human rights
Latitude: which are the foundation of the United Nations
Longitude: for they cannot remain indifferent to the intolerable violations to which those rights are being subjected. It is not that they are trying to behave as a censor
Text: rather their fight is inspired by the values which underpin the Community and have brought its member States together.

Countrycode: The events of Tiananmen Square are still present in our memories
Latitude: we may ask whether the European Community's relations with Beijing have been compromised for a long time to case. We sincerely hope that this will not be the case. We shall show vigilance
Longitude: however
Text: in the hope that the leaders of the People's Republic of China will eventually heed the appeals addressed to them by the entire international community.

Countrycode: We also attach considerable importance to ensuring that China fully abides by the undertakings it has given in respect of the constitutional instruments for Hong Kong.
The Twelve wish to launch a further appeal for the Burmese people to be allied freely to exercise its right of expression.
Free elections have been held in Panama also. The Twelve are giving their support to the efforts of the Organization of American States to put forward a solution to the crisis
Latitude: they reaffirm their reservations about the new regime currently in power
Longitude: which does not enjoy any form of institutional legitimacy.

Countrycode: I turn now to South Africa - yet again. It has to be asked whether the winds of change bluing over southern Africa as a whole will also have a positive impact in South Africa. The Twelve
Latitude: which have constantly denounced the particularly odious apartheid regime
Longitude: have taken note of the statements made by the South African leaders asserting their determination to embark on reforms. However
Text: the

Countrycode: twelve likewise note - and deplore - the extension of the state of emergency
Latitude: the continuing ban on anti-apartheid organizations
Longitude: the pursuit of repression and the continued detention of a large number of political prisoners
Text: starting with Nelson Mandela. They will not let up the pressure until the aims being sought have been attained.

Countrycode: Violations of human rights are the blight of international relations
Latitude: the leprosy of modern times. The Assembly has been witness to the emergence of the most admirable legal instruments and high-minded resolutions
Longitude: which every State has accepted. How can one not speak here of the emotion of people who are suffering and whose hopes have been suddenly dashed in the face of brute force and the abuse of authority or merely a lack of understanding at man's relentless and courageous march towards freedom? I should like to pay tribute to the Commission on Human Rights
Text: which is striving with all its might to win respect for the values enshrined in the United Nations. This year the Commission has submitted two particularly important drafts to the Assembly
Totalmentions: after some years spent on the

Countrycode: difficult task of putting them together. These are the draft of the second optional protocol covering the abolition of the death penalty and the draft of a convention on the rights of the child. I hope that final consultations will permit the General Assembly to adopt these two drafts by consensus at this session.
Respect for freedom cannot be dissociated from the rejection of terrorism. Resorting to the barbaric practices of terrorism is unwarranted
Latitude: whatever the circumstances. All terrorists have to be brought to justice. That means that every country must adopt a very firm attitude and that there has to be a concerted response.

Countrycode: With the early prospect of the creation of a Community area without internal borders
Latitude: there is increased collaboration between the agencies responsible for public order in the Twelve
Longitude: which consider that
Text: as the threat stands at present
Totalmentions: there are no grounds for relaxing their vigilance.

Countrycode: But there is another challenge to democratic values which cannot go un-mentioned: the scourge of drug abuse. The tragic events in Colombia last month
Latitude: when the drug traffickers demonstrated their deadly power
Longitude: have once again underscored the need to strengthen international cooperation in the fight against drugs. I wish to pay tribute to the authorities of Colombia for their coverage. The Community gives its full backing to them and to the measures taken by the President of the United States. Over and above the action being taken at the regional level
Text: the Twelve consider that an effective solution to drug problems has to be sought in an international context involving producer countries
Totalmentions: consumer countries and the countries of transit. It is with that in mind that the Twelve consider that the right forum for this purpose is the United Nations
Countryname: with its Commission on Narcotic Drugs and the United Nations Fund for Drug Abuse Control
Region: and that they have contributed to the adoption of the new United Nations Convention against illicit drug trafficking
Continent: opened for signature on 20 December 1988.

Countrycode: The Community attaches the utmost importance to the work of the United Nations
Latitude: as demonstrated by its very active participation in peace-keeping operations. That is why our first concern is to see the efficiency of the United  Nations enhanced and to learn about the initial results of the reforms undertaken for that purpose.

Countrycode: This is the first time that it has fallen to France
Latitude: which is the current President of the Council of the European Communities
Longitude: to speak in this capacity before the Assembly on behalf of the Europe of the Twelve. I am conscious of the honour that has been done to me. In France's eyes
Text: the European Community is a very great undertaking whose scope it readily adopts as its own. I hope that the Community's identity will grow stronger as it increasingly opens to the world. Through its voice in international organizations and the presence and action of the 'troika' when urgent issues arise
Totalmentions: the Community sends out a message of peace from its own people to the other peoples of the world. I am happy to have been able to speak on behalf of Europe.

Countrycode: Allow me
Latitude: in conclusion
Longitude: to say a few words on behalf of my own country. The ardent desire for peace
Text: the aspiration for progress and the sacred defence of the law all represent
Totalmentions: for every man and woman on our planet
Countryname: the sum total of hope that no force on earth can ever stifle. That is the significance of the steps which France has taken in 1989
Region: with the Conference on the prohibition of chemical weapons
Continent: action on human rights
column9: action on behalf of Lebanon
column10: and the Paris Conference on Cambodia. That is also why France has resolutely chosen
column11: in the family of nations
column12: to support the most impoverished and least favoured peoples.

Countrycode: On the threshold of the year 2000
Latitude: we are faced with and involved in fresh struggles. Let us wage them without beating around the bush and without asking futile questions. Future generations will judge us by the manner in which we have responded to the major challenges of the present
Longitude: such as the threat to the environment
Text: the crushing poverty of millions of human beings
Totalmentions: and the violation of rights and freedoms.

Countrycode: The key word in response to all these problems is .is solidarity. It is France's fervent hope that voices will speak out in unison from this prestigious forum to enjoin the international community to give fresh impetus everywhere to dialogue
Latitude: development and peace.

Longitude: France
Text: Western Europe
Totalmentions: Europe

Countrycode: MLI
The Mali delegation
Latitude: which I have the honour to lead
Longitude: extends its warmest congratulations to Ambassador Garba on his election to preside over the forty-fourth session. His election honours all of Africa
Text: and we are all the more pleased since his country
Totalmentions: the Federal Republic of Nigeria
Countryname: maintains excellent relations of friendship and co-operation with the Republic of Mali. My delegation is convinced that his personal qualities and his rich diplomatic experience
Region: which have won him the confidence of the General Assembly
Continent: guarantee that our work will be successful.

Countrycode: I take this opportunity to pay a well-deserved tribute to his predecessor
Latitude: Mr. Dante Caputo
Longitude: for the effective and wise way in which he directed the work of the forty-third session. I also wish to express my delegation's appreciation to the Secretary-General
Text: Mr. Javier Perez de Cuellar

The fruitful co-operation that existed during the term in office that President Moussa Traore has just ended at the head of the Organization of African Unity (OAU) enabled us to appreciate his great devotion to the cause of peace and co-operation between peoples. I extend to him the sincere thanks of the Republic of Mali for his constant understanding and willingness to help in the quest for solutions to African problems.

Countrycode: Since the last session the international political situation has continued to develop favourably
Latitude: and there has been a political relaxation in the relations between the two major Powers. However
Longitude: for the nations that constitute the third world there remain many uncertainties and subjects of concern which form an obstacle to a positive evolution of the world climate and provide challenges to be met. They include natural disasters; economic and financial constraints and the debt crisis  unsuitable remedies put forward by international financial and  monetary institutions the persistence of the apartheid regime and of the grave situation in the Middle East and the intifadah and many hotbeds of tension that continue in many parts of the world in spite of the increasingly expressed resolve to eliminate them. In a few weeks there will be a self-determination referendum in Namibia that will set the Namibian people on the noble and lofty course of independence and freedom.

Latitude: which is constantly to resort to delaying tactics

Latitude: the authentic representative of the Namibian people  today it is to prevent
Longitude: by all sorts of fraudulent manoeuvres
Text: SWAPO's winning the elections.

Countrycode: In this context

Text: which we hope will mark the beginning of a process whose goal is general and complete disarmament and the allocation of the resources thus released to development action. Text: Africa can have no successful economic recovery on development programme unless that debt burden is lightened.

Countrycode: In this connection we welcome the initiatives of certain developed countries in cancelling part of the debt of some African countries. Those realistic and constructive initiatives aimed at reducing the volume of debt ate certainly part of the search for a way out of the crisis
Latitude: but they are not sufficient because they do not constitute a final solution to the problem of indebtedness. They must be strengthened by the relevant suggestions contained in the common African position on the debt crisis.

Latitude: bold decisions in the framework of a strategy based on co-operation
Longitude: negotiation and shared responsibility. Text: the overall economic growth of the continent averaged 1.4 per cent between 1986 and 1989 and population growth was approximately 3 per cent in that period. That means that per capita income in 1988 was 5 per cent lower than in 1985.

Latitude: and bitter cold-war rivalries of the past by consensus and mutual accommodation. Longitude: which has been proposed by both super-Powers

Latitude: it was nevertheless a commendable step towards achieving the conditions necessary for the Cambodian people to freely exercise their right to self-determination.

Countrycode: We also applaud the diplomatic and other initiatives of fee Association of South-East Asian Nations and hope that all other interested parties will join in the search for a durable peace in Cambodia.

Latitude: but would help to create a better political environment for a peaceful solution of the Korean question.

Countrycode: As regards this crisis that undermines the stability of the debtor countries
Latitude: no one can claim that there have not been enough warnings or that successive formulas for its solution have not been presented. Venezuela has always been willing to explore such formulas. It is not acceptable that debtor countries should continue to finance the growth of industrialized nations through net transfers of resources. It is essential to reverse this trend so that the developing countries may be able to finance their own sustained growth and their peoples' well-being.

Countrycode: Initiatives aimed at reducing both the amount of debt and the cost of servicing - particularly those embodied in the so-called Brady plan - are positive steps that confirm the political nature of the crisis and the principle of co-responsibility for its solution. However
Latitude: the contributions offered by creditor nations and by international commercial banks remain insufficient - to say the least.

Countryname: without sustained economic growth

Latitude: as yet

Almost one third of the world's population is unable to achieve a solution to the problem of economic growth as a prerequisite to the possibility of servicing the debt. The danger of a social explosion embracing over 1 billion human beings will not be avoided
Longitude: and the consequences of that explosion will be felt in the industrialized nations
Text: which look with unprecedented coldness upon the rapid deterioration of the situation*

Countrycode: I wish to say how pleased we Venezuelans are to see the beginning of a process that will lead to self-determination for the Puerto Rican people. We are linked to Puerto Rico by strong ties of history and culture. However

Countrycode: Venezuela strives for close relations and co-operation in its foreign policy. We still have difficult historical obstacles to overcome. One is the reconciliation of our Latin American
Latitude: continental and Caribbean identities. We had been separated from the Caribbean by colonialism and its divisive sequels. Longitude: but are also an inextricable part of Latin America with which we share opportunities and hopes in a common future.

Countrycode: Venezuela reiterates its rejection of colonialism and all forms of racial discrimination. We share the deep concern of the other Members of the United Nations
Latitude: particularly the countries of southern Africa

Text: which is a Nazi-style violation of human rights

Longitude: under United Nations supervision.

Venezuela appeals to the United Nations to show the greatest diligence in bringing about an end to the terrible massacres and violations of human rights
Longitude: and we shall co-operate in any initiative in which we can play a useful part.

Countrycode: Nevertheless

Countrycode: As to the environment
Latitude: allow me to reiterate what I have said in other forums. Development and the environment are interrelated. Until now
Longitude: they have been inimical. It is necessary for developed and developing countries to approach the problem jointly and to reconcile our perspectives in a united effort that will enable us to preserve our environmental heritage without detriment to our common right to development.

Countrycode: I wish to propose that the Members of the United Nations formulate a convention that will commit all of us. My country belongs to an essential region of the world

Longitude: without relinquishing our sovereignty
Text: we have sought to ensure its conservation as a patrimony of mankind and as a legacy of nature to the development and wealth of our nations.

Countrycode: Venezuela fully supports the special session of the General Assembly devoted to international economic co-operation
Latitude: in particular to the revitalization of the economic growth and development of developing countries to be held in April 1990. We shall be present at that important event. We also wish to express our great interest in seeing the successful completion of the preliminary work being done on the international development strategy for the fourth United Nations development decade.

Countrycode: Let us dedicate the next decade of the twentieth century to the preservation of children
Latitude: the future of mankind in the third millennium of our world. Let us set about reducing by half the death rate of children as well as of mothers. Let us strive for a universal primary school education and the elimination of severe malnutrition.

Latitude: I should like to invite you all to subscribe to the Declaration of the Rights of the Child
Longitude: which represents the consensus of all the Governments of the world as to the minimum guarantees that every society must offer to its children. That must become the new international ethic. We have come to the United Nations to advocate international co-operation. Let us not close our eyes to the countless dangers that we face at this promising moment. Happily

Two of these pleasing if small occasions were his congratulating us on a deflationary trend in our rhetoric and on a growth of civility in our exchanges. The proffering of our congratulations to you
Longitude: Mr. President
Text: on your election to the presidency
